result.execSummary:
The defendant Brinkley L Bridges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)4.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge.
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges as to each count.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision, by the end of sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.  Random screening.
----------------
The $30,000.00 confiscated should be forfeited as proceeds of a drug trade if not already Federally seized.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) year of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial confinement.
If defendant possesses a firearm at anytime in the future, defendant will be subject to a mandatory three (3) year Initial Confinement pursuant to 941.29(1)(g).
Also advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts one and two.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three, but consecutive to counts one and two.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.  If defendant possess a firearm at anytime in the future, defendant will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement pursuant to 941.29(1)(g).

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 21 years with 462 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 11 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 10 years; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 3 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years - consecutive to Count 1; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years - consecutive to Count 1 & 2; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years and 462 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 3 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 5:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years - concurrent with Count 3, but consecutive to Count 1 & 2; pay plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment.  Court grants motion.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the parties, Court adjourns sentencing.  Court cancels the 2-12-16 date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties mutual request to adjourn the sentencing heard and granted.   State to produce the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties move to have the sentencing adjourned from 12-16-15 for further investigation.  Parties spoke with the Court in chambers.  Court grants motion.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

After speaking with the Court previously, parties move to adjourn sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties move to adjourn the sentencing.  Court grants motion.  Order to produce is cancelled for 9-21-15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, & 5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.
Court grants defense motion to adjourn case.  Negotiations ongoing.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7/1/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of motion and motion to adjourn, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5/11/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 7/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Brinkley L Bridges not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests additional time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/19/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, NOTICE OF APPEARANCE FOR COUNSEL.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Brinkley L Bridges in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
